title: lucifur
author: lucifur
created_time: April 28, 2023, 11:36:55 AMLast edit: April 28, 2023, 12:57:36 PM by lucifur
content: Hi everyone, a few days ago he made a post here asking for someone to do a data entry job and he also had one before about designing images.He agreed on making a deal but after asking for atleast an escrow or a downpayment he no longer respond to my message.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3544144There is no money involved yet but I just want to put this as a warning incase he makes another post here asking for help. Atleast a decent guy will reply that he no longer need someone for the job instead of ghosting.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Anyone can come on this forum that needs someone's service in return for money. What I am saying is that you supposed to add the person's username so that we can all know the person's username.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: lucifur on April 28, 2023, 11:36:55 AMAtleast a decent guy will reply that he no longer need someone for the job instead of ghosting.It doesn't necessarily mean that he is ghosting you. It's possible that he is dealing with some personal issues or just busy with other things.It's also possible that he may have been suspicious when you asked for a down payment. Given that your reputation on the forum is relatively unknown, it's understandable that some might not feel comfortable trusting you with money upfront without using escrow.Also, as _act_ has already mentioned, it would be helpful if you could provide the username so that we don't have to guess.

comments.author: elevates
comments.body: He might not be aware of the escrow culture or he might not be interested in going ahead with escrow. Unless he has scammed someone I think it is pointless to raise a topic and suspect him. If you are not comfortable working with him then leave the discussion rather than pointing fingers. There have been recruitment for community management jobs on the Service board. I never seen anyone asking them to have an escrow account. This thread doesn't make any sense to me as you can't force someone who is giving you a job to necessarily have an escrow account before the recruiter hires someone.

Distrust him, tag him or flag him just because he stopped responding? Ghosting is not a crime. It is not ethical but being not ethical isn't a crime too. If you need a service you can create a topic and give out the details. You can state there that you won't do any business unless each party agrees to use an escrow. That way you will guarantee that you will only be getting applications from those who accept your terms.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: To be honest with you all, I won't judge this guy, simply because this is something I've done before when I was still pretty new on this forum, and trust me, I had no evil intentions of any kind, it just happens that, sometimes, I wil feel like i need this to be done, and need some one to do it for me, I will come on the forum to post about needing such a service, and immediately I find someone who's interested in doing the job, I will start feeling like I don't need that service yet, mostly due to other expenditures, and my type of person don't know how to tell clients to forget about providing the service I requested for, that I am no longer interested, I just go quiet..So probably, this user is my type of person, what I would advice is, never you take any potential job or service serious, until the person or user interest in the job or service pays for it, this will save you alot of heart breaks and disappointments.
